courseName: Front-End Web Developer Nano-Degree, Information Technology
courseDescription: ​During the nano-degree I learned some skills needed to become a Front-End Web Developer. I've developed projects using HTML5, CSS3 and the Bootstrap framework to create projects like this portfolio. I've learned and used Javascript and jQuery to dynamically fill out a curriculum project. In addition, I developed projects such as the arcade game in JavaScript and mapping applications using the Knockout framework. The course also covered Task Runners (Grulp and Grunt), Git and testing frameworks (Jasmine).

courseName: Responsive Website Development and Design Specialization
courseDescription: ​During the specialization I used the following languages: HTML, CSS and Javascript to develop responsive websites using the Meteor.js framework. At the end of the course, I developed a web application using the concepts of responsive web design and Single Page Application.

​I researched about Contemporary Brazilian History, specifically the presidential elections of 1950, which is the subject of my thesis. I worked as tutor for History of Brazil II (Imperial Brazil) and History of Brazil III (Contemporary Brazil). Also, I had a scientific scholarship, which resulted in a chapter of a book.
